( Carnage: Pardon me if this post does not quite make sense, I wrote it 
quickly.)

* Dinobot�s entire weight was leaning against the side of Necormancer, the 
approaching feeling of stasis lock building with every breath he took.
This wasn�t good, not good at all. If his last fluid pump expired then he 
would die, slow and painful.
That was the very thing that worried him, more then anything at the moment.
But then, something out of nowhere came into view on his right side, 
something that hadn�t come into focus yet�and touched him!
Dinobot quickly stood up and snapped his entire body around, the force of 
the action sending droplets of his own mech-fluid to splatter against 
Necromancers side.
It took his optic a moment to adjust; however, once it did he found no 
reason to be alarmed.
It was that smaller bot whom he had told to help Tavatron, one in which he 
knew not the name of.
He straightened himself up the best he could, taking in consideration about 
just how damaged he was and the only thing he could manage was a shoulder 
slumped stance.
This was all getting far too much for him, the surprise from this bot only 
feeding his rage and speeding up his damaged systems.
Dinobot glared at the small bot for a moment before relaxing his stance a 
bit�mainly for need of relaxing the muscles in his back and preventing them 
from getting a charley horse.
He listened to his words�and for once in his life had to agree with him.
Dinobot needed help and he knew it�and would be a fool to swipe it aside 
now.
But then as he was about to accept Foxfingers� assistance he heard a 
familiar voice, one in which was belonging to a particular femm in which was 
pissing him right off at the moment.
The tone of her defying voice causing his head to snap in her direction, 
teeth bared and muscles strained.
He wouldn�t care to say so, but at this very moment he hated her�absolutely 
hated her. The sound of her voice, the feel of her aggression in the air, 
even the sight of her completely pushed his aggression further and further 
to complete and utter rage!
To this point he had controlled himself the best he could, and tried his 
damnedest to keep his temper to at least a rate where he could control 
it�even barely.
Dinobot�s tail thrashed as he listened to her words, his control nearly 
breaking and unleashing the side of him in which he hadn�t used in all his 
years in fear of never gaining sanity back.
He was known for berserk fighting�which bordered at insanity�and if he had 
to use that style of combat now�so help the poor souls in his way.
But instead of expressing the rage in which racked at his very being, a 
sudden hush came over him as he straightened himself completely out. His 
shoulder-plates no longer slumped and his tail swaying calmly behind him.
He had indeed collected himself, so to the point that he was utterly beyond 
anger now�and that was death to anyone who, so much, as looked at him wrong.
Dinobot glared at Tavatron, but now his aggression was beyond expression�and 
he simply looked at her coldly. The rage completely disappearing from his 
features, though his muscles remained tense.
This was it, completely IT!!!
He had had enough of her and her back talk, and was utterly sick of her and 
her jabbering tone.*

� Of COURSE it would make a difference! I, for one, would NEVER have let you 
engage in battle in the first place! Not after what it took me to get you 
back!!�

* His mind was just as red hot as his temper, and if he didn�t watch himself 
he would end up saying something�or even doing something that would 
eventually tip one of them off the edge.
But, he wasn�t really thinking at the moment either, rather more acting then 
anything else.*

� And existing as a Transmetal 2 has NOTHING to do with whether or not you 
would have been captured. It was complete STUPIDITY, which had the result of 
your fate.
You KNEW better then to simply go alone, yet you ignored your logic and left 
alone anyway!�

* His clawed hands were in fists, but not a single vision of his rage had 
escaped�other then the occasional raising of his voice.
But it was also then that Dinobot saw Tavatrons temper slightly become more 
controllable, watching her every move as she approached him.
He say the collected anger in her optics, but even as she was now in control 
of HER anger, he knew that it was about time that he became the master of 
his own.
But, that would not be easy.
He watched as Tavatron walked up to Necromancer, agreeing that it would be 
far better to ride back then walk, despite his anger it was also a slight 
relief to have her within sight and without such a high degree of risk if 
being attacked if she would have walked.
Dinobot turned his head towards the smaller bot by his side, Foxfinger. 
Wondering vaguely if he was coming along with them.
His anger, strangely enough, was beginning to die down. Basically to the 
point where he simply didn�t feel�anything.
And the reason for that, though not apparent to him now, was that his 
systems were shutting down and effecting his mental, neural capacity 
circuits. Whish meant, soon he wouldn�t feel anything, be able to touch 
anything, be able to do anything.
For, his fourth fluid pump had already began to deactivated, there was just 
no extreme pain to announce it.
The mech-fluid flow which went to his brain to supply it with oxygen was 
beginning to slow down, and if he wasn�t careful and wastes his time to get 
back to base, he would basically be brain dead.
Dinobot growled, the anger spiking up once again, but nothing as serious as 
before, more dampened and calm.
However, his expression didn�t change, emotionless, cold, and aggressive.
He looked up at the large dragon now, seeing Tavatron comfortably resting on 
his back, then looked back down at Foxfinger, gesturing towards 
Necromancer.*

� If you are coming with us, then get on.�

* His voice was harsh and wet, mech-fluid already coating the inside of his 
mouth and lips.
Dinobot didn�t wait for an answer though, there wasn�t enough time, for, he 
had to get back to base and into a CR chamber quickly.
His own repair system was offline, and it had been since he had first been 
hit in the side by one of the Alliance missiles.
He quickly, or as quickly as he could, climbed up and onto the back of 
Necromancer, careful to make sure that he sat a good 10 feet down his back 
and away from Tavatron. He didn�t need any of her back talk now.
Around this time his breaths were coming short, and Dinobot had to force 
himself to let go of what anger he had in order to concentrate on breathing.
He quickly transformed into beast mode once he was on the back of the 
dragon, thinking that maybe there was a chance to slow down the lose of 
mech-fluid with only that once chest wound.
Dinobot looked at the perimeter of Necromancer�s back and then got into a 
comfortable position, laying on his stomach with his head resting on his 
front limbs�staring at Tavatron�s back.
If anything, he was about ready to depart. *
